intro: Amsinckia leptostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed flossflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, fluffy seed head that gives it its common name. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks. Amsinckia leptostachya is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
